## R Markdown
```{r load}
library(tidyverse)

games <- read_csv('ncaaf.csv')
games <- games %>% select(player = home, week, season) %>%
  bind_rows(games %>% select(player = away, week, season))
```


```{r per_season}
season_counts <- games %>% group_by(season, player) %>% summarise(count = n())

# There's a big jump at 10, so lets say anybody with 10 or more was real
ggplot(season_counts) + geom_histogram(aes(x = count), binwidth = 1) +
  labs(y = '# teams', title = 'Frequency of games in a season per team')
```

```{r seasons}
n_games <- 10
full_season_counts <- season_counts %>% 
  filter(count >= n_games) %>%
  group_by(player) %>%
  summarise(full_seasons = n())

ggplot(full_season_counts) + geom_histogram(aes(x = full_seasons), binwidth = 1) +
  labs(y = sprintf("# of teams with at n seasons of at least %s games", n_games))

# A bunch at 10, top "tier" at 14+, so I'll filter on teams with 14+ seasons of 10+ games
```
